body: Would be nice if the icon also loads without authentication. This is mandatory for it to show up in password managers like Bitwarden.

issue.body:
### Does your log mention database corruption? No

Latest Ubuntu/Firefox/New account
Although, syncthing icon displays OK in the tab.

Message in Firefox Inspector (translated): Cookie « CSRF-Token-E4YNY » will soon be treated as a cross-site cookie regarding « https://127.0.0.1:7374/assets/img/favicon-default.png » because the schema does not match.

Maybe this is only the name favicon-default.png that FF doesn't like for bookmarks.

body:
It looks like for the favicon to load without authentication will require a default page -- at present the default page (which loads before authentication) is just a piece of text "Not Authorized". Once authentication takes place, the default.html page is loaded, which has the scripted favicon at issue above.

I"m not finding any html source to modify the "Not Authorized", so I suspect that it is direct output rather than served.

It seems that serving an initial unauthenticated html page would be the appropriate method for serving the initial favicon.

issue.title: Add static favicon

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

This PR adds a static favicon with the path `/favicon.ico` and exempts it from the authentication logic. This allows Bitwarden and probably other tools to pick up the favicon even if the web UI requires authentication.

~~TODO: modify index.html to first load the static favicon in order to solve #7638~~

### Testing

Successfully loaded the favicon without logging in.

issue.body:
### Purpose

Added a static link to the default favicon so it shows up in a static context such as the Firefox bookmarks (fixes #7638 and #7260).
The favicon now also shows up in Palemoon (doesn't  dynamically adapt to sycthingStatus()).

## Authorship
Felix Dumbeck

issue.title: gui: Favicon not working in Firefox bookmarks

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### What happened?

Firefox doesn't show any favicon at all when adding a bookmark to the Syncthing GUI, even with the static favicon introduced by #8850. It looks like Firefox prefers the last favicon that is found in `<head>` which is the link to `favicon-{{syncthingStatus()}}.png`. Because that file is not available on initial page load, it is not considered for bookmarks. The favicon logic for Firefox can be found [here](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/c09764753ea40725eb50decad2c51edecbd33308/browser/modules/FaviconLoader.sys.mjs#443).
Switching the order of the favicon links in `<head>` fixes the behavior for Firefox while breaking the dynamic favicon for Chromium-based browsers.
A proper fix for this issue was suggested by @ajshea in https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/7638#issuecomment-838888561.

### Syncthing version

v1.27.6

### Platform & operating system

Linux x86

### Browser version

Firefox 124.0.2

### Relevant log output

_No response_
